climbs.name: U-Wall Drool
climbs.fa: Peter Croft, Bruce Kay & Tami Knight, January 1982

content.description: This route climbs a narrow streak that forms from seepage underneath the impressive University Wall. The route actually climbs the line of a slabby sport climb called "The First Course" and ends at the trees to the left of the P1 anchors forÂ the University Wall. Probably best to rappel the route, but also possible to walk off to the left on the standard U-Wall approach which follows a narrow ledge down and climbers left of Seasoned in the Sun. About 60-100m right of Seasoned in the Sun. If it's in, it'll be hard to miss. Screws, and possibly the occasional bolt if ice is thin, especially near the base.

A collection of ice routes that occasionally form on the Stawamus Chief.

Most routes require a solid 4-5 days of consistent, below freezing temperatures to reliably form.
